values:
I think I'm starting a blog. I'm moving my dalai lama spiel to it. It's going to be positive and upbeat and hopefully not depressing and rant-ridden. I like live-journal, but I also want to be on the blogosphere bahahaha.
Asenath, Chelsea, and Woody: if you guys see this post of mine, I want you to check it out.
www.puttingmetogether.blogspot.com

I know some people think that I write really weird things in my livejournal...that my livejournal is always so serious etc etc etc. But I'll tell you one thing...I haven't been on this thing since God knows when and I am thoroughly pleased at the caliber of my entries. 

Other than that...I know I've stopped lj-ing (for the most part)...but I'm surprised at the number of you that are still on. It's nice to know that you're all still here.

I really do buckle under pressure. :/ i wonder why i didn't during APs...
I was reading the interview that alma made for me and I'm glad that I didn't half-ass it. I've written things that I really believe in and want for myself and others...it keeps your mind on the ball. 
"I" and "i" should not be interchangable...and yet...
i think i'm completely free of an obsession(and no, it's not drugs). freedom=liberation=the ability to move forward. hallelujah. 
I am also glad that I finished the entries on the Dalai Lama. Reading them is like re-living it. 
I haven't talked to Mrs. Burgess in a long time :(
Why does college expect you to PROVE that you've learned everything? Isn't going to class enough for them???
Jolly Ranchers have too much color in them and too much dye too. My tongue feels red and sugary. gross. 
Am i a horrible writer? I didn't think I was until this year. It's funny how college affects one's perception. 
I want water. I want to swim. I want to be able to wake up at 6am and not freak out about finals, turn around, go back to sleep until 8...where I will get out of MY own bed, get the paper, and make tea. mmmm tea.
My roommate has promised me that next semester will be much easier to handle. Hell it better be. 

Other than that, I'm in love with life.

Your element is Water: Understanding, intelligent,
quiet and calm. You know who you are and no one
can change that. Usually quiet but only because
your listening, don't let anyone think you
haven't got an opinion! You're not quiet because
your shy or sad, you're usually quiet because you
are thinking. Your answers are well planned and
helpful so people generally seek your advice.
You're the perfect balance between solitary and
outgoing. But sometimes you need a little time
to yourself to sort out your emotions and
figure things out. You understand the phrase
'sticks and stone' and rarely let things get to
you. What's that important for you to have to
get so upset over? You know what you want out
of life but are simply taking your time and
enjoying things. To you your life is fine as it
is, you can always change things later if you're
not happy.

.:-|What is your true element?|-:. -With Anime Pictures and detailed answers-
brought to you by Quizilla bahahahahahahaa. i feel so damn emo. but i really do like anime pics...

6 and a half months and 36 sleepless hours later...I've realized that high school is...over.
I know I go home almost every weekend but I still miss home. Home is where people care about you, where people have time to spend with you, where people stay up for you when you have too much homework, where you can ask for help and receive it...from parents, from teachers, from friends. I miss friends who I don't get to see, regardless of whether or not I talk to them. I go home, but it's not home. I see people here everyday, but I still miss them. 

Maybe it's just the lack of sleep, but there are times I just don't know what to do.

It's amazing how connected the internet makes you feel. One minute I'm sitting completely isolated, focused, dilgently working on my essay, and the next minute my internet has suddenly started working and I feel like I am traveling the world...
It's an odd feeling.

This new live journal format is freaking weird. WEIRD I TELL YOU.
It's 1:12 and i'm doing a research report
My knees hurt so bad...
I saw chinese acrobats at centennial hall and felt like royalty. :)

Note: before you read this, please acknowledge that there are two preceding parts to this final flow of words. (see below)

 

 

The first words out of the Dalai Lama's mouth were, I am a human being.

 

He is. Moreso than anything I have ever seen before. Today I realized how much it meant to me to go see him.

The topic was, once again, finding peace in a world of violence. According to him, the fact that we even address this topic means we need peace. If you're not hungry, you don't need food. If you're not starving, you don't demand it. Therefore, there is some truth to our need ing peace more than ever, because as a global society, it's something that is constantly on our minds.

He stressed compassion. I said this already, but compassion is what leads to internal disarmament. With compassion, our state of mind is more even. It's like when we have a strong immune system, little things don't bother us. The thing doesn't even have to be little. The stronger and healthier our state of mind, the greater we are able to handle irritants, because frankly that's all they are. As human beings, we have the ability to get over things and to move on. I think it's one of the greatest gifts, and for this reason there is progress. We look at things as challenges...disturbances in our life should only be minor, an insignificant bump in the road.

When internally disarming ourselves, what are we disarming? Anger. (yet again yoda comes to mind). All of the wars in this world are an outcome of anger...which is only possible if one is focused on only one cause and blind to the rest. Then we feel we can destroy the cause of whatever makes us angry. But in reality, it's a monster which only consumes us. If your neighbor hated you, and you were mad at your neighbor, and decided to remain in the house, not go out, be mean to friends...you've lost your support, you've given in to your anger, and most of all, you've hurt yourself and have made things easier for your enemies. When an individual feels anger, he mistrusts everything and everyone. You cannot have real friends if you mistrust them. All around you will be suspiscion, which will only increase other's suspiscion of you...leading to a vicious cycle. If you have real friends, who you are compassionate about...who care about you (which can only happen when you are generous with your kindness) you will be a happier person...

Suspicion is the cause of fear and anger. It is not society that affects an individual, it is the individual that affects society. We cannot allow for this suspicion to continue. If it does, there is no point in external disarmament.

Yes, external disarmament deals with nukes, weaponry, etc. But if we are open to dialogue...

Conflicts occur. The Dalai Lama said that... of course, conflicts will occur. (All it needed was a "duh") We're human. It's what we do. But if we are open to resolving conflicts with dialogue...progress will be much easier.

There are two sorts of defenses. Long term and short term. In the short term, we can sheild ourselves, have a strong defense...and if we must...have a strong offense. It is necessary. But this does not look at the cause...correction: causes. To anything, to any attack, there are always multiple causes. We must be able to step back and understand this. Once we are able to, we will no longer be angry...because we will understand, we will be compassionate. We may be annoyed, perturbed, but that will pass...because we will make an effort to work on the causes of the attack. We will care, and that's more of an attack than anything is.

Only then can we be externally disarmed.

 

Followed by a question and answer session, with questions one would normally ask the dalai lama. How can we all get along and the like. Compassion was the answer.

How do we raise our children? I don't know...followed by...care for them. Show them your love, set an example, be with them.

How does the theory of karma fit into Darwin's theory of evolution? That's too long. Not enough time. The person should read more books. lol

Listening to him made me realize that there is some truth in the phrase "Om Shanti, Shanti, Shanti." That there were living examples of it. Usually, listening to someone in saffron robes makes me want to punch something. Like, how can people have so much blind faith? But the Dalai Lama didn't have blind faith. He just believed in humanity. I guess that's why I wasn't exactly inspired persay, because it was so obvious...and he doesn't put on a show of divinity...and he emphasizes that he is human. He told us of how, when he was young, he broke a pocket watch in two, out of anger, because the hands weren't moving. But there is something in the man that makes you think, makes you ponder.

Up till this moment, I thought i was becoming an adult...in the negative sense. More practical and without the power to save the world. I should just try for medical school...or pharmacy...have a career, a regular life. That I should completely settle for the normalcy of life. Average citizen, average woman, average mother, wife, employee, middle class tax payer, whatever.

I now know that I am becoming an adult...in the positive sense. I am becoming more practical. I just have to find a way to use this newfound power to save the world.

My first impressions:

As we took our seats I realized that the last time I was in a place that could hold this many people who wanted to see a prominent figure...was at the Bush rally. Now for those of you who could never see me going to a Bush rally, you're right. However, I was under the impression that it was a speech (we dressed up and everything), and although I'm not too happy with our (meaning the the U.S.) current political views, I respect my president and am willing to hear him speak, no matter how much trouble he has doing said activity, because, after all, it is the chance to go hear the president speak.  Plus it was an amazing experience because of the people I was with...no matter how gung-ho they were -_-' *no more years!* :P

The stark contrast with this event and the bush rally was that everyone was a lot more mellow. They realized the age and the importance of the figure who they were going to see and at times the hall was pin-drop silent. When Deepika and I went to go sit down, we were apologetic for having to step over people to get to our seats. As per the custom we were told that it was "no problem," but what impressed me, and may seem a bit hippyish to some of you, was that we were "welcomed" by the people sitting next to us. Literally. The types of people, at both events, weren't all that different. You had the media, and the dignitaries, and the common folk who came because they believed in what was being said. But instead of the hardcore-redneck-get-off-mah-property hicks, there were the 50-piercings-on-their-face tree huggers. Bottom line: There are weird people in every group. But: The hippies definitely are not as belligerent as the hicks, no matter how weird and disconcerting it may seem. You're not going to get beaten up by hippies if you don't believe what they believe. (Sorry about the reference to the sterotypes, I know many of you are not like that...realize that I'm speaking about the extremes).

Case in point: There were people outside the convention center with signs saying "Jesus is our savior" etc etc. and no one cared...well, maybe one woman, but even she was like "I believe that Jesus was a great man, but is there really any point for you to be here right now?" lol.

Random Thoughts on the Lama...lol:

As I mentioned before, just as we were sitting, His Holiness the Dalai Lama and his esteemed translator were just stepping out on to the stage. The first thing he said was "I hear there are young people here today." Smiling, Deepika and I looked at each other and applauded loudly. I believe I told you that there was free seating for students yeah? Unfortunately they were all the way in the back, because that was where the majority of the loud applause came from. Just goes to show how much importance is actually placed on the "future of the world," as was stressed by the Dalai Lama himself. *aside: I am getting wearied of referring to him as the Dalai Lama every time and want to call him the Lama. But, although that would be appropriate, I keep getting pictures of Kusco and The Emperor's New Groove every single time.*

The Dalai Lama is an extremely funny man. He could be a stand up comedian for serious people...and completely get away with it. He immediately asked for a moment as he took off his shoes and crossed his legs, after which he laughed because he found this way more comfortable. Now although that may not seem funny, you have to understand that here in front of us, was this 70 year old man, who had the world's weight on his shoulders as both a political and religious figure, yet he was laughing hysterically like Yoda...and that too, about something so trivial. Many times the joke would only bring a smile to one's lips, but would be amplified into belly laughs, simply because of the Lama's contagious joviality (word?). And yes, the Dalai Lama reminded me, numerous times, of Yoda.

Before actually getting to his point:

Now that he was completely situated, he began by sending a message to the victims of Katrina. "You must have hope. You must rebuild. You must rise from the ashes." He cited cities and countries that had been completely annhilated by natural disasters, as well as war ravaged areas of the world and pointed out that they could do it, that they did do it, and that they were stronger for it.

His actual talk was on "Achieving Peace in a World of Violence." Sappy, leftist, idealistic topic...I know. Let me tell you, as someone who is constantly disillusioned with the UN, there is no one more cynical about world peace. My conservative friends scoff at the impracticality of the idea, but me? I want to believe it badly, and knowing that it is impossible pains me to no extent. I am a critic who wants to believe...I am the best kind of critic, the best kind of believer...the worst kind of follower. But: on a personal level, his philosophy appealed to me. It's nothing I haven't heard before..."compassion." Sammie said it all the time. "Do we really need a religion? Why can't we all just be human?" 

The Dalai Lama's solution to violence:

There are two kinds of disarmament, internal and external.
Internal disarmament must be practiced by the individual for it is the individual's tenion and stress that causes tension and stress in a society.
Without this peace in the society, external disarmament cannot be acheived.

more to come...

Friday: I go home and am vaguely told that the Dalai Lama is coming to Tucson. Of course my mother wants to go, and she wil be bringing my grandparents too. Well, with the ensuing "practice" and "set-building" the details are completely left out. (I came up with that dance in 20 min for those of you that care.)

Saturday: morning consists of dance, of course, where once again i waste time. Shruti is absolutely adorable. That morning my mother has spoken to my grandparents who will be coming that night to attend Ganapati Ustav. Our play kicks ass...and "we now own the MM" (Golwalkar 2005), though really, it should be the "PMMMMMMMMMMMM." Anyways, that night my mother explains to me that we're going to the seminar at the Tucson convention center. I'm excited.

Sunday: Here's the plan. Because my mom and grandparents are coming, there's no point in going back to tucson tonight. wtf???? my mother expects me to leave the house at 6:00 in the morning to reach my 8:00 bio lecture. I've been sleeping all day (getting rid of the shitty sick feeling), which, in essence, has been wasting time. ie I still need to complete my English paper and math homework. I'm beginning to care less and less. Sunday night: I go on ticket master to see how much tickets are etc. um....SOLD OUT. So now it doesn't seem like we're going anyway, plus I'm still in flipping Chandler...ha, without my homework done either. Whatever. I'm ok with it. I can't sleep since I've been sleeping all day, but i still don't end up finishing my paper...so pretty much Sunday never ended for me.

MoNdAy: We leave at 6:30. I'm effing tired. I woke up early this morning to try to pull another Stafford-esque homework...but to no avail. So now it's me with my laptop in the car trying to finish. It's only four pages. shit. My dad's going to try to get tickets by going directly to the box office. meh. I have lost all faith. I think it's pointless.

I miss bio lecture... for the third time. I wasn't planning on going anyway.

At around 10:10 I get a call from my dad saying that they might have some tickets left in the student seating area. (My dad is still in shock over the fact that he spilled coffee all over his chair, and at this point it's all he can think of) Two per student. (If you recieved a phone call from me today at around 10:30 it was for this reason...we wanted at least three tickets) So we trudge down to the convention center...through ghet-to Tucson. Guess what? none left. none. I'm too nice to be pushy. So, a bit dejected (I'm not really that surprised) we drop me back off to campus to meet with my English teacher (at the effing CCIT building which took forever to find), after which I go finish my math, eat lunch, turn in my math, and sprint to lab.

On my way there, my dad calls. "Your mom's on her way, give her a call." WHAT??? I thought we decided that there were no tickets!!!...er, apparently my mom's willing to take the chance. "Alright Aai (it's what i call her)," I tell her apprehensively, "try to get two tickets. Call me only if you get two." I'm at the lab now and tell professor what's up. She commends my mother's perseverence. woohoo. So i'm cutting my last sleeve of dishes when my back pocket starts to buzzzzzzzzz. "I've got two tickets Lalita, do you think you can get a ride here?" huh? are you serious? "Yes...I just don't want to leave because parking is horrible." I remember seeing the number of tickets that sold out in today's Daily Wildcat. "Yeah, I'll try to get a ride there." The only person I can think of is Deepika...who, drives over from the apartment, picks me up at the UMC, and takes me to the convention center. On the way there my mom calls again and asks if Deepika wants to go too...duh...So, SOMEHOW, my mother gets this amazing floor seat. Not only that, but me and Deepika park illegally, run to the center and are allowed straight in (thanks again to my mom) without having to wait in the ridiculously looong line, something along the lines of 7,300 people. When we get in, the Dalai Lama has just come out on to the platform and is taking a seat.

It was so unexpected, so random, so bizarre, that it is questionable whether the experience even had the desired result...

"...What a man is and makes of himself; not what he has or hasn't done for others. There is no substitute for personal dignity."
-Ayn Rand (The Fountainhead)

To all of you who have taken steps toward independence and to all of you who will be doing so in the coming weeks.

Hullo all, and how are we on this fine morning?
Today feels like a good day. You know how in the movies people wake up looking fresh and beautiful (not my everyday waking up experience thank you) and then go into the kitchen, make coffee, go outside, enjoy the morning, then come inside...still drinking their coffee, and check the morning news on their laptops? ok...even if you don't know that particular folger's commercial lol...that's how my morning was...is.

I mean for goodness sake...I'm listening to indian classical music.

There are only two weeks left of summer. I'm moving in on the 18th.

I've been complaining about how I want the summer to be over. Now, don't get me wrong, even though I've been going insane from time to time...lol without real human contact...I've been doing a lot of things that I wouldn't be able to otherwise. I'm just getting really tired of this lousy weather. Honestly, summer would be a lot nicer if I could actually go outside...without burning my skin off.

I was telling this to my alaskan roommate, who naturally can't wait for the heat because it's already getting cold up there. Well, it's almost fall...and according to the basic western seasonal descriptions...it's supposed to be getting cooler. duh. My roommate is cool tho...hahaha...cool... (lol you know you laughed...at least pretend you did...) If I haven't told you about my shitty rooming situation...it's me and my effing procrastination at its best. The cheat sheet version is that I applied late, got waitlisted and had to find an apartment. It's not so bad tho, the place is right across the street and is pretty much like a dorm anyway. (ie the assigned roommate). Now I just have to go shopping. yes. me. i said shopping. now shut up and let me force myself out the door.

I'm really really excited for college. Today I spent about three hours at Preeth's house because my effing computer wasn't letting me do the academic tour. Point is I'm really really really ridiculously excited now. I wasn't before at all which made me sad. I've always thought that one of the most important things about college is being excited about it, and because it was instate...i just wasn't. I thought that I might have ruined my life...etc...and getting shit about it from other people wasn't encouraging. i guess i just really let it get to me because I was so damn dissapointed in myself for "selling out" or "being a slacker." I don't know... However, the idea of actually signing up for my classes and living in a dorm and realizing that check in is only two months away...yup it's gonna be good.  :-)

I think I'm coming down with a cold or something. My throat is itchy...but I can't sleep. I haven't been able to sleep properly for the past week now...however, going online seems to be futile since there are only nine people on...mostly idle with away messages. It's dumb...so tonight i didn't even try...watch, with my luck everyone is actually having some sort of midnight AIM party. Whatever. I'm online way too much lately, every freaking night...makes you realize how tired you aren't, how hard you're not working, how much time you actually waste in your life...and yet it's so damn addictive.

I think i'm going through midnight depression. It's like insomnia with a sadistic twist. ew. i don't like it. Positve thoughts: Oh yeah...guess what I won! So my mom works at Philips and so like a good daughter (bahahahahah) I apply for the scholarship...well, I made the final cut but not the bajillion dollar prize...so guess what the consolation prize is? A new CD system/radio. It's flat so you can hang it up on your wall. It's so freaking sweet. I was happy. I put it together and literally sat there for like 30 min just opening and closing the CD port thingy...it slides up like something straight out of a sci-fi flick. sooo cool. soooo not taking this down to Tuscon...lol.

I've decided that girls are weird. But guys are just confusing. It's a wonder that we all get along so well....

I'm sorry, did I say get along well? I must have been delusional for a split second there. Clearly I don't read the papers. :-(

I've also decided that I've tried keeping in touch with people that i want to keep in touch with. AIM, my friends, is a godsend...and those who really matter to me...i've tried. For those of you who are awesome...I've seen around. and the rest? well that depends on how much I mean to you. Sometimes you have to make the effort to talk to someone...I'm done being the "bitch," the one who genuinely makes the effort. Sadly, I'm on the verge of not caring anymore. I wish i wasn't. Crikey. late night bitchiness...that's what this is. Sorry....about that.

Oh man. People are retarded. I feel lame. I just need to talk to someone.

With this increasingly cosmopolitan society that we live in, foods and other such cultural items that once used to isolate and identify various civilizations have now become commonplace...everywhere. Seriously, some things that are suited to Norway, for example, are not suited for Trinidad and Tobago, and yet if you want Norweigan food in the Bahamas, you can get Norwegian food in the Bahamas. Getting things from India in the US used to be so expensive because shipping things was so damn difficult. But with this globalization and increase in technology it is even possible to grow tropical plants in Michigan. Still, even though I understand the increasingly easier concept of preservation of culture away from the "motherland," is it always so prudent to fight to keep your tradition and culture in a place that is so ill-suited to harbor it?

question: how do you reconcile the uber-feminist point of view with "i want a guy who's bigger and stronger than me?" I know people who are so pro-woman that it's overwhelming...but want someone "manly" in their life.
plus...no matter how you match up to someone intellectually, walking through a parking lot by yourself at night is always going to make a woman feel more insecure than a man. yes, no?

dekho na...
zara dekho na...
tum ho, main hoon, aur yeh tanhaaiyaan hai...

What does one do when one feels unaccomplished? 

What does one do when one doesn't know how to react, how to approach something?

What does one do when one feels like they've let the opportunity of a lifetime slip through their fingers...about 13 days ago, actually.

An idle mind is that devil's workshop, they say, so i guess depression is the onset of having a lack of things to do. So i need to do something about not having anything to do. 

Get a job? Perhaps. 
Where? I don't know. 

What does one do when one doesn't feel like anything is changing, when it seems like it's still the middle of April...of junior year...even though there is no possible way it ever could be. 

I think I kinda understood what heartbreak was this year...though it wasn't due to a person. 

I was told that I am a bad listener today.
I don't like listening to people griping all the time about their oh-so-sad life, because damn it, complaining is going to get you nowhere. 
I don't like people griping about things that they could have done something about. 
Some people don't deserve to be bashed for trying their hardest, especially by those who either a)didn't do shit about it or b)did shit about it and are just griping to be cool. 

Hence, I don't care that I'm a bad listener. 

But I wonder, if I were in the same position...would I gripe? If I wanted to blame my lack of success on someone...would I gripe? Would I get mad if no one listened?

I say horrible things sometimes. Sometimes I say stupid things. Sometimes I'm just naive. Sometimes I don't know what to think about people, and sometimes I wonder what they think of me. 

Ambiguity is quite poetic. Hopefully I struck a nerve, brought out an emotion, whatever. If not today, then I plan on affecting the world in some way...so you can't stop it, it's going to happen eventually.

Today I've though of a lot of these things and haven't come to a conclusion simply because I am convinced by both sides. heh. Maybe this is why I understood Kerry. Maybe I now have too open of a mind. The result of that is lack of conviction. Great. I have no conviction.

My annual catharsis? more like my daily catharsis of the past two weeks melded into one. It may not seems like it, but I think too much, talk to myself too often, and daydream constantly. Quite pathetically so.

i asked people to leave inspirational messages, and in addition to jon's oh-so-convulted phrase lol...
"shoot for the stars and even if you don't reach them, someone's bound to moon you..." or something like that...eli totally made my day.

eznkv: "High achievement always takes place in the framework of high expectation." -Jack Kinder
eznkv: "Do or do not. There is no try." -Yoda
eznkv: "The dictionary is the only place where success comes before work." -Mark Twain
eznkv: "There are two mistakes one can make along the road to truth - not going all the way, and not starting." -Buddha
eznkv: do your bio

thanks to everyone for being oh so amazing. This is not just for bearing with me and bearing with each other during the ridiculously stressful time that we're all going through right now, but for the entire year...and all of the ridiculously stressful times that we've been through. Everyone from my we the people (i'm so proud of my unit 5 boys), to my science researchers, to all of you who i've just vented to about random things...whether it be politics, people, or just situations...you've given me so much in just two short years.

Lots of Love,
Lalita

I fell asleep on the couch last night, while i was reading biology and simulateneously babysitting my brother and his friend. Suddenly the door bell rings and it's already time for the kid to go home. I couldn't even say bye to his dad i was so drowsy. Some babysitter I am. Some biology student I am. 

Welcome to the livejournal page of the number one timewaster in the entire world. Thank you for visiting. Have a nice day.

The Visionary You are charming, outgoing, friendly. You make a good first impression. You possess good negotiating skills and can convince anyone of anything. Happy to be the center of attention, you love to tell stories and show off. You're very clever, but not disciplined enough to do well in structured environments. You Are 70% Normal (Really Normal)
Otherwise known as the normal amount of normal You're like most people most of the time But you've got those quirks that make you endearing You're unique, yes... but not frighteningly so!
How Normal Are You? i have been labeled normal. i'm sure many of you would dispute that claim. you have to understand that my weirdness (excessive or not) is what makes me "endearing." rofl.
Your Seduction Style: The Coquette
You are a pro at playing the age old game of hard to get. Your flirting style runs hot and cold, giving just enough to keep them chasing you. Independent and self-sufficient, you don't need any one person to make you compelte. And that independence is exactly what makes people pursue you.
What Is Your Seduction Style?
What is a coquette you ask? does that make me sound like some sort of slut?
You Are a Conservative Democrat

Frankly, the way most other Democrats behave embarasses you greatly. You pride yourself on a high level of morals, and you have a good grasp on right and wrong. So I'm running out of time. For everything. This not only applies to senior project crap, which I'm actually on top of...kinda, and not only to AP's, which I'm definitely not on top of...so very very far away from the scores that I want on every single damn test, and not only to the 50 bajillion other things that I'm stressing over, housing par example...as of now, i'm going to be a hobo in tucson next year, but also to what I want to do in life. Ah. That age old question "what do you want to be when you grow up Lalita? A doctor? An engineer? (lol for those of you that understand that) or are you going to break out of the mold and go into law?" I half want to see what people would say if I told them that I was going to be a sidewalk chalk artist...in Tanzania...from 3am-12pm, Monday thru Friday...Saturdays 7am-10am and take Sundays off. 

Anyhow, 6 min. break is over. Back to actually worrying about everything, too bad I can't watch Team America in 6 min...

i quit.

Ce n'est pas seulement pour les personnes qui peuvent comprendre le francais, mais je pense que seulement ils peuvent ce comprendre. Pourquoi est-ce que j'ecris en francais aujordhui? Parce qu'il faut que je le practique, et j'ai decide que je vais practiquer quand je peux.  

Je desteste ecrire en francais. Ma diction et mon grammaire sont toujours plus simple...en anglais je peux ecrire les chose complique sans le dificulte...ce n'est pas toujours facil, mais pour le plupart je ne tombe pas sur les mots. Ca, c'est un idiom, oui? Si vous pouvez le comprendre...peut-etre vous me corrigeriez? Si vous ne le comprennez pas...je pense que c'est vos bonne chance, parce que c'est-a-dire que vous n'aviez jamais eu la classe de francais, et vous n'allez jamais avoir la chance de rater l'examen d'AP.

Je ne peux pas utiliser les autres mots, les autres expressions, donc les vieux hommes de la <College Board> va dire que ma composition est <redundant>. Aussi, je veux parler, mais avec qui???? Mes amis n'ont pas les temps ou ne veulent pas parler. C'est impossible de passer c'est examen car j'ai manque un ANS de francais!!!!!!!

My brother's birthday was today. We played laser tag. so much fun. The little marathi boys are absolutely hilarious. They had like this 24 birthday bash cuz Sagar had a sleep over last night and then we picked them up from there and took them to Stratum. ha. it was great. I had to go pick up stuff for goody bags and pump gas in my car (the light had been on since last night) so I got to go there by myself. I took 101 and then 60...it was my first time on the 60 by myself. yay. I need a CD player for my little baby...I can't listen to cassettes forever.

Last night we had people over and had like a mini, informal singing party. I haven't had one of those since Albuqueruqe. However, whoever started singing set the pitch freakin high and everybody was streching their voices like crazy. it was bad.

Friday night Alma came over and we finally did her mehendi. finally. and watched Devdas lol...waste of time...waste of a LOT of time, the entire night actually. Her henna looks flipping amazing though. seriously. and i'm not just saying it to brag cuz last night i did it on my own hand and it looks like crap. So go see her mehendi if you have time :). (Alma, you should take a picture of it and send it to me hahahahahahahahha) We started the movie at one and it ended at like 5 and got soooo boring for the both of us. I told her we should watch Amar Akbar Anthony, that GENIUS movie, but the Devdas cover (the book kind), frankly, is ten times cooler.

I drove around a lot yesterday too cuz i had that philips scholarship to take care of. I barely had the $14.00 that i needed to overnight it, which would explain why I had not a penny to purchase fuel for my automobile and ran on empty of two hours. Yes, i know that's not safe. I've already had to have my dad bring me gas while I was stalled in the school parking lot. lol.

Not much else to say. not in the mood to psychoanalyze anything at the moment, so i guess you've all been spared.

Lots of Love,

Lalita

Hullo all. interesting weekend it has been. can't say i'm completely proud of it, but for the most part everything is A-OK! kinda. we'll see. 

now for the not-so-annoyingly-vague update...

My glands are swollen and my eyes are tired and hurting and my neck is sore and it hurts to swallow and i have to go to school tomorrow. I wish i could just stay home. I wish i could go cosmic bowling. I wish that life would be easier. I wish that I didn't analyze everyone and everything to death (i guess that comes with being an AP student). I wish that Diana's professor will get in touch with Professor Eloy Rodriguez and that I'll be able to go to South America. I wish that people would stop being so addicted to drama because most things don't deserve to be blown out of proportion *idiots*. I wish that I could take compliments better...yeah a weird wish...i know...I wish that I could get over this ridiculous fascination with boys...lol...not completely cuz otherwise i wouldn't be ok with myself, however it's a flipping distraction and i feel cheap, which I HATE. I wish that my nose wasn't crooked...hahahaha...stupid low-self esteem induced worthless wishes...might as well wish for world peace...it's that pointless (the sad thing is that i'm excluding many wishes which fall into this category). I wish we had won...sigh, again pointless. I wish people didn't have to go through horrible shit in their life. I wish I had a yacht and that I knew how to sail. I wish that school wasn't almost over, yet I wish it was... I wish that my project will come together for CARSEF and I wish that we kick everyone elses arses. I wish the college board didn't exist. I wish that I could spend time with people who I haven't seen in a long time (i miss you guys). I wish that I could spend more time with people who i see all the time. I wish I was more disciplined and that I didn't have senioritis. *must resist not doing homework* I wish school started later, though I would still probably be late...every single flipping day...I wish I could still dance. I wish I had a higher singing voice and someone to be my teacher. I wish I had no homework. I wish I had monies. I wish I would stop wishing for things, get up and go DO stuff...ha. I can do that. 
I'm out. later

The Economist is flipping amazing. I just wish I had known about its amazingness before. I mean, not even the times or the post has such relevant articles. I guess that's the difference between international newspapers and those catered to an American audience. Nothing wrong in that...i mean, with such a kickass economy, who needs to care what happens in the rest of world? We'll just see how long that kickass economy can hold us up before we HAVE to pay attn to someone more powerful...(i hope the day never comes)

Speaking of international news...MUN was ridiculously amazing. The Russian/UK alliance was the strongest thing there. *sigh* good times...i've never been such a good munner in my life. Having such a kickass country really made a difference, can't wait till college. However, the entire experience has been quite disillusioning. While writing resolutions, each country is always so worried about their national sovereignty...it's understandable, but then wth is the un there for???? Honestly, like the whole ECOSOC sub-comittee the UK and I made, it should just be a discussion forum where countries can bring things up. Force is not going to work cuz no one likes bringing a third party into it. This is why federations are so shitty. Which brings me to the fact that Russia, no matter what it says, is not in any way a federation.

Moving on to something not so serious or political, I woke up late today. It was great. M & M-azing lol. Then i leisurely did my econ homework and got to school by 11:30, after driving around for 20 min with the windows down, just in time for the WTP mtg. in the corner of the econ room. HAHAHAHAHA...talk about factionalizing. We're actually DOING stuff...which makes me proud. Yes, proud. I said it. PROUD. (thank you btw, it means a lot)

er...why do people think i'm some sort of a intellectual saint? (I'm talking to various ppl online who are comparing themselves to me...and then telling me that i don't have a life.) I understand that i'm not "into everything" but is that a reason to be prejudiced? Answer me that, why dontcha.

the subject says it all. I think i've given up on school. hahahaha. yes. me. 
it's nearly 11:00 and i have nothing better to do than to be online because i can't sleep. I have a bio exam worth 40% of my grade tomorrow. I have a resolution to actually do my homework in the classes that had been neglected last semester due to undertakings which I have decided that I would undertake all over again in a heartbeat. Though the bittersweetness of said activity would be so much better if we could only apply what we know. 

Okay...here it comes...

I understand that it's been a month, and yet I can't help but cringe and/or want to hit something everytime any reference is made to our performance that fateful january day. If I've discussed this with you, I've probably told you about my rapid journey through the five stages of grief...you may scoff, but to the fourteen (sixteen including Spears and Norman) of us it was a HUGE thing, which deserved grieving. I can't help but wonder if we could have done anything different, or if we had just changed ONE thing, or answered ONE question...(gah). But that doesn't matter. What's done is done, which is why I'm ok with it. Life moves on yada yada yada...and no matter how cliche it is, it's the truth and it has made me a better person. What I did, what I learned, what I went through, was for the sake of the knowledge itself and I did not expect any reward, persay, in return. We have won because of how powerful we are now. In fact, we all pay attention to the same things in the news and are able to analyze and understand that everything cannot be taken at face value. Though I may not be able to say the same for everyone, instead of being brainwashed and partisan, we think about issues and accept different points of view because we want to make the best decision. I love you all and still consider you good friends even if we don't talk all the often anymore. Why? Because we're a team, and we're elite. 
Which is why we need to kick it up 20 notches. Not just one damnit...twenty. What's the purpose of the damn program? To win effing nationals? I don't think so. The purpose is to learn how to apply the fundamentals of our government to issues that play a hand in OUR lives. If we can do that, as a team, as a group of people who freaking CARE, what more do we want? There are so many things we can battle for, so many things we can have an impact on, so many things that we can DO for the sake of our nation. And ya kno? If we're so damn elite, who says we have to go grassroots? We KNOW ppl. We know how to HANDLE ppl. And we can bypass all the shitty stuff and take it straight to the top. I know all of you have some shit that you're worried about or that you want to change. All we need now is a way to implement it. It has to be for the benefit of the nation whatever it is, and we have to do it fast. We've alreay got a club...we just need to change the objectives of it. We can do charity...tsuanmi anyone? We can bring issues to the mainstream...ha. darfur...damn bastards. We can do anything. Have you seen us? Have you seen who we are? Everyone expected us to win damn it...and win we will. For those of you wanting recognition...what's more important...winning nationals in a structured, practiced environment? or actually doing shit to change this country to what WE want instead of letting the preceding generation screw it up for us as they currently are... I do believe the latter holds more importance in convictions and in admiration. In fact, I would much rather gain national recognition that way...instead of some obscure first place win. 
We know what we are capable of. In regards to implementing it...why the hell not???

So...life is still weird. In fact it's so weird that i really do feel like the fifth wheel in all aspects. I mean, even my cousin has a boy. Don't get me wrong Ela, it's awesome...but like everything else this week...it's "hella weird." I'm ok with it...but i'm not sure how much longer my sanity is going to hold out because I've never been so saturated with this topic before. Everybody either talks about boys or has one. Maybe I just need some new friends... any advice? AAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

And now for the day to drive itself off a cliff...

3. Stupid world history that i have to do or can't graduate...lol

Plus...science research is driving me nuts. My plant is not the problem...in fact it is so not the problem that it's already able to do everything that I want to test. First off, trying to kill bacteria with extract seems like such a juvenile experiment...the fact its been done makes it suck even more. So, two days ago I decide to change the entire thing over and test it as an insecticide...which hasn't technically been done. Now I have to go read up on fruit flies...annoying buggers... though I WANT to work with mosquitoes...yes, even more annoying. However, it seems like i'm going to do the e-coli thing anyway, just because ms. clark needs me to "have something for HISEF." bah humbug. *sigh*...Drosophila here I come...or as ms. richmond calls em, Drososophia...like some Russian princessa. lol.

And speaking of RUSSIA...

I'm really really really ridiculously excited about MUN. Really. I've had to do WMD, chemical and biological warfare and other such shitty stuff for three monotonous years in a row. HA! not anymore! I'm going UNDP/ECOSOC/ILO baby! Economic and Social improvement...hell yeah. I know I know...UN=paper tiger...and positive rights are worth no more than a rupee...but to me it seems more practical than trying to get belligerent nations to form nuclear weapons free zones. Though disarmament of "dangerous nations" isn't going to happen with Idiot America* trying to shove it down people's throats. Sometimes we can be excessively stupid...
